alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued March 03 at 4:43PM EST until March 04 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet, with locally higher waves up to 10 feet in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Mobile Coastal County. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until midnight CST tonight. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life- threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal
